articles.description: David Moyes says it is "great to be back" after being appointed Everton manager for a second time.
articles.title: David Moyes named Everton manager for second time

articles.description: Los Angeles Lakers head coach JJ Redick describes the "devastation and destruction" after losing his home in the LA wildfires.
articles.title: LA wildfires: Lakers head coach JJ Redick's home burned down

articles.description: Manchester City agree £33.6m deal with Lens for Uzbekistan central defender Abdukodir Khusanov.
articles.title: Abdukodir Khusanov: Manchester City agree £33.6m deal for Lens defender

articles.description: The star names have arrived at the Australian Open for a season-opening Grand Slam which has already thrown up intriguing storylines.
articles.title: Australian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic, Emma Raducanu, Jannik Sinner & Nick Kyrgios among talking points

articles.description: Graham Potter says West Ham's display at Aston Villa gave him "encouragement" - even if his pre-match "excitement" was short lived.
articles.title: West Ham United: Positives for Graham Potter after Aston Villa FA Cup defeat

articles.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan, the defending champion, will miss the Masters in London on medical grounds.
articles.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan: Defending champion withdraws from Masters

articles.description: Gael Monfils makes history by becoming the oldest winner of an ATP Tour singles title after triumphing at the ASB Classic in Auckland.
articles.title: Gael Monfils becomes oldest ATP Tour champion with Auckland win

articles.description: Manchester United and Portugal full-back Diogo Dalot speaks to BBC Sport's Betty Glover about new manager Ruben Amorim and the difference he's brought to the team.
articles.title: Diogo Dalot reveals changes under Ruben Amorim at Man Utd

articles.description: The International Cricket Council should do more to support the Afghanistan women's team, says England captain Heather Knight.
articles.title: Heather Knight: ICC should do more to help Afghanistan women

articles.description: Glasgow Warriors book their spot in the knockout stages of the Champions Cup with a clinical destruction of Racing 92 at Scotstoun.
articles.title: Glasgow Warriors 29-19 Racing 92: Hosts book spot in Champions Cup knockout stage
